text: hi everyone is Alan here today I will be
making salted egg or removing
traditionally is made by covering the
eggs with a thick layer of black
charcoal paste but it can also be made
by soaking the eggs in brine the yolk is
rich and fatty which is normally used to
make moon cake to symbolize the moon it
can also be tough on cupcakes or cope
with other foods as a flavoring you can
also boil the whole egg and eat with
congee because it's very difficult to
buy duck eggs here in Europe today I
will use chicken egg instead the taste
and texture of our chicken eggs will be
a little bit different than duck eggs
but is still a good substitute so let's
begin recipe in a saucepan add 1 liter
of water that's about 4 cups to that
we're gonna add a slice or two of ginger
cinnamon stick start a nice black
kademan and a few clothes you don't need
to use all the spices that I use here
just you one or two types is okay they
will make the eggs more fragrant and the
heat in these spices is going to help to
speed up the brining process bring to a
boil and then simmer on low heat for
about 5 minutes for one liter of water
we're gonna need about 200 to 250 gram
salt also add a teaspoon of sugar give
it a good stir to dissolve all the salt
and sugar then let cool to room
temperature you can test to see if the
brine has enough salt in it by propping
agreeing up cooked rice into it if it
flows to the surface the price at enough
when the bride has cooled completely
arrange the eggs in the glass jar and
gently pouring the brine
use a small ceramic condiment bowl to
place on top to make sure that the eggs
are fully covered in the brine and
that's it you're done just leave it on
the counter or kitchen shelf for about
three to four weeks you should not leave
the eggs in the bride for more than 30
days otherwise that the yolks and the
whites will be mixed together after four
weeks just crack the eggs and separate
the yolks that white is rather liquid
and salty normally we discard the egg
whites the yolk is firm and has a very
beautiful orange red color concentrating
other nutritions even if you're not
going to use them right away you still
need to separate the yolks after four
weeks baked or steamed and then freeze
them before cooking soak the yolks in
some cooking wire to remove the smell
then brush with some vegetable awesome
Ewa
and bake in the oven at 100 degrees
Celsius or steam them for about 10 to 15
minutes
you can also heart by the whole eggs for
about 15 minutes and then serve with
rice or congee when it's served with
congee is called Khao jang-ho with Mui
is a very popular dish for late supper
in Vietnam the dish mainly consists of
playing white rice porridge and side
dishes of your choice like braised fish
and pork salty pickles pop floss etc the
side dishes are intentionally made quite
salty so that they could roll well with
the plain porridge and of course hot
boys so the duck egg is the perfect
addition to the dish I really love them
as much as I love the dishes you
prepared and send me photos on social
media with hashtag head and recipes they
all look so yummy thank you so much for
sending in your photos and I'm looking
forward to seeing more if you like this
video don't forget to click
and subscribe to my channel for more

watching bye bye
